Complaint Letter


When you run into applications that have trouble with your real name—apostrophe and all—don't just accept it! Copy and Paste the text below as a starting point for your protest. Send the edited text via the general mailbox or contact us section of the offending service, or edit in Word, print and send via regular mail. Be sure to add your own details, and include a screenshot if possible.

Click on the button to copy the text. Then paste (ctrl+v) into a contact form as a starting point for your complaint.

"Just when the caterpillar thought the world was ending, he turned into a butterfly." --Proverb
"Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people." --Eleanor Roosevelt
"No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." --Eleanor Roosevelt

Dear (Contact Person or Organization Name):

Re: (account number, if applicable)

On (date), during the account registration process with your service, I entered my name into the field labeled "name". Unfortunately I received an error that my name is not allowed (or has illegal characters, etc).(Include a screenshot if possible).

To resolve this problem, I am requesting that your developers make any changes needed to the account registration process so that I can use my actual name with your service. I have an apostrophe in my last name and I understand that malicious actors exist that might attempt to exploit any security vulnerabilities with having special characters in forms. I further understand that with additional development efforts, any security risks can be eliminated or greatly mitigated. A substantial number of other services have figured out how to accept my real name — including the apostrophe—in their forms.

I look forward to your reply and a resolution to this issue.

Sincerely,

(Your name)

Not supported in IE9 and earlier.
